summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both mentioned as components of the BTEX group, which includes benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, and xylenes. They are part of a broader discussion on the characterization of petroleum hydrocarbons in environmental spills. However, the context does not provide specific details on their individual interactions or significance beyond their classification as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in analytical standards.
